Package com.github.fge.largetext.load Description

Classes dealing with file I/O

The fundamental problem here is that what is aimed at being implemented is a CharSequence; none of its methods "support" throwing any kind of exception, so all exceptions thrown by methods in this package are unchecked.

Among things that can happen are:

  • file I/O errors (either disk failure or, if reading from a network filesystem, temporary network failure),
  • decoding error: at some point, the decoding process gives up because it cannot decode a byte sequence to a character sequence.

Another problem is that decoding takes time. While this will probably not be noticeable for "casual" uses of this package, consider that the decoding process is single threaded for a reason (see TextDecoder; if, for instance, you are asking for the number of characters in a 2 GB file, you will have to wait until the decoding process has finished its job.

Some notes on memory usage:

  • this package makes use of FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long) to map raw file contents, so that part is not eating valuable heap space;
  • however, decoding into a CharBuffer (this is done using CharsetDecoder.decode(java.nio.ByteBuffer) does consume heap space.

The notes above are for the decoding process only, which happens once per file. Memory usage of a LargeText instance depend on how much you require at a time from its attached TextCache instance; its backend is a LoadingCache (from Guava) with an expiry policy of 30 seconds after last access. At this moment, this is not configurable.
